alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 12:57AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, Johnson, northwestern Yell and western Pope Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1257 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ozark to Hartman to near Magazine. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Clarksville... Paris... Dardanelle... Pottsville... Lamar... Dover... London... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Blue Mountain... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Mosley... Taral... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas.
